table.style: border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; font-size: 11px; font-family: verdana; vertical-align: top;

tr.style: border: 1px #F0F0F0 solid; font-size: 11px; font-family: verdana; vertical-align: top

th.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : var(--ig-left,left); background-color: white; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; padding-top: 3px; padding-bottom: 3px

a.title: The logical name of the element

th.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : var(--ig-left,left); background-color: white; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; padding-top: 3px; padding-bottom: 3px

a.title: Information about the use of the element

th.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : var(--ig-left,left); background-color: white; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; padding-top: 3px; padding-bottom: 3px

a.title: Minimum and Maximum # of times the element can appear in the instance

th.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : var(--ig-left,left); background-color: white; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; padding-top: 3px; padding-bottom: 3px; width: 100px

a.title: Reference to the type of the element

th.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : var(--ig-left,left); background-color: white; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; padding-top: 3px; padding-bottom: 3px

tr.style: border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : var(--ig-left,left); background-color: white; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(tbl_bck1.png)

a.title: A set of ordered Quantities defined by a precise low and high limit defined by a fixed quantity (no comparator) with UCUM or EDQM unit

tr.td: high bound with UCUM or EDQM unit

title.value: Range with UCUM or EDQM quantity units

description.value: Range with low and high unit UCUM or EDQM encoded

short.value: Set of values bounded by precise low and high fixed quantity (no comparator) with UCUM or EDQM unit

definition.value: A set of ordered Quantities defined by a precise low and high limit defined by a fixed quantity (no comparator) with UCUM or EDQM unit

comment.value: The stated low and high value are assumed to have arbitrarily high precision when it comes to determining which values are in the range. I.e. 1.99 is not in the range 2 -> 3. Low and high limit are precisely defined, no element 'comparator' in the simpleQuantity defining each bound. The limits are defined by a fixed quantity (no comparator) with UCUM unit.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
If present, low SHALL have a lower value than high

map.value: NR and also possibly SN (but see also quantity)

definition.value: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

description.value: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

definition.value: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

comment.value: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

short.value: low bound with UCUM or EDQM unit

definition.value: unit of measure SHALL be UCUM or EDQM encoded

comment.value: If the low element is missing, the low boundary is not known.

requirements.value: force UCUM or EDQM unit encoding

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

short.value: high bound with UCUM or EDQM unit

definition.value: unit of measure SHALL be UCUM or EDQM encoded

comment.value: If the high element is missing, the high boundary is not known.

requirements.value: force UCUM or EDQM unit encoding

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

short.value: Set of values bounded by precise low and high fixed quantity (no comparator) with UCUM or EDQM unit

definition.value: A set of ordered Quantities defined by a precise low and high limit defined by a fixed quantity (no comparator) with UCUM or EDQM unit

comment.value: The stated low and high value are assumed to have arbitrarily high precision when it comes to determining which values are in the range. I.e. 1.99 is not in the range 2 -> 3. Low and high limit are precisely defined, no element 'comparator' in the simpleQuantity defining each bound. The limits are defined by a fixed quantity (no comparator) with UCUM unit.

short.value: low bound with UCUM or EDQM unit

definition.value: unit of measure SHALL be UCUM or EDQM encoded

requirements.value: force UCUM or EDQM unit encoding

short.value: high bound with UCUM or EDQM unit

definition.value: unit of measure SHALL be UCUM or EDQM encoded

requirements.value: force UCUM or EDQM unit encoding
